service.name: Assistance for Isolated Children Scheme Pensioner Education Supplement
service.description: AIC Scheme Pensioner Education Supplement (PES) is intended to contribute towards educational costs incurred by parents of geographically isolated students undertaking primary or ungraded levels of study. PES is paid for students receiving, or who qualify for, a Disability Support Pension or a Parenting Payment (Single) and qualify for either Boarding Allowance, Second Home Allowance or Distance Education allowances (as applicable), except for the requirement not to be receiving a pension.

Dimension.name: Assistance for Isolated Children Scheme
Dimension.desc: Help for students who cannot go to an appropriate state school because of geographical isolation, disability or special health needs.

Dimension.name: Rural and remote Australians
Dimension.desc: A range of payments and services is available to support people living in rural and remote areas.

Dimension.desc: Delivering a range of payments and services for people at times of major change.
